column1: At a town hall meeting January 6, 2008 McCain was reported to have answered a question on the Armenian genocide by noting that he recognizes the Armenian genocide, but opposes the Armenian Genocide Resolution due to the Turkish government's sensitivities and the importance of their continued contribution to the war on terror.[123] On September 29, 2008, in an open letter to the Armenian-American Community of the United States he stated, that it is fair to say that one of the greatest tragedies of the 20th century
column2: the brutal murder of as many as one and a half million Armenians under the rule of the Ottoman Empire
column3: has also been one of the most neglected" and that "it is our responsibility to recognize those tragic events".[124]"
column4: At a town hall meeting January 6, 2008 McCain was reported to have answered a question on the Armenian genocide by noting that he recognizes the Armenian genocide, but opposes the Armenian Genocide Resolution due to the Turkish government's sensitivities and the importance of their continued contribution to the war on terror.[123] On September 29, 2008, in an open letter to the Armenian-American Community of the United States he stated, that it is fair to say that one of the greatest tragedies of the 20th century
column5: the brutal murder of as many as one and a half million Armenians under the rule of the Ottoman Empire
column6: has also been one of the most neglected" and that "it is our responsibility to recognize those tragic events".[124]"
